parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To gather together, assemble. From sun and athroizo; to convene.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A field-laborer; then: a laborer, workman in general. From ergon; a toiler; figuratively, a teacher.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(including the other inflections); from toi and houtos; truly this, i.e. Of this sort (to denote character or individuality).
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To know, know of, understand. Apparently a middle voice of ephistemi; to put the mind upon, i.e. Comprehend, or be acquainted with.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
From ergates; occupation; by implication, profit, pains.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wealth, gain, plenty. From the same as euporeo; pecuniary resources.
